channel.title: Exercises on Yuan Tian
channel.description: Recent content in Exercises on Yuan Tian

item.title: Flight Data Havesting Flight24
item.description: Harvesting the Flight Data from https://flightaware.com/ Step 1: Get all the flight number Use Dest_ICAO and Source_ICAO to get all the flight numbers between two airports: https://flightaware.com/live/findflight?origin=CYXE&destination=CYYZ Dest_ICAO and Source_ICAO are 4-digit airports ID Register a free acount with FlightAware, then you will have access to 90 day history of a flight. E.g., get 80-day history of a specific flight number WJA506. https://flightaware.com/live/flight/WJA506/history/80 Sources:

item.title: Statistical Analysis Using R 3rd Edition (Chpt1)
item.description: 1 Chapter 1 1 Chapter 1 library("tools") library("HSAUR3") data("Forbes2000") ls() ls(Forbes2000) print(Forbes2000)

item.title: Handbook of Statistical Analyses Using R
item.description: 1 Chapter 1 - Introduction to R 1.1 Import the Dataset 1.1.1 .csv File 1.1.2 .xlsx File 1.1.3 .rda Files 1.2 Export the Dataset 1.3 Get the Meta-data of the Dataset 1.4 Simple Summary Statistics 1 Chapter 1 - Introduction to R 1.1 Import the Dataset 1.1.1 .csv File library(HSAUR3) ## Loading required package: tools # Method 1: data("Forbes2000", package = "HSAUR3") # Method 2: #csvForbes2000 <- read.

item.title: Functional Programming in Scala
item.description: Functional programming (FP) finally goes mainstream. It is not a new concept, but it is absolutely a complex one for beginners including me. I got exposed to a large set of references, online courses and books, and I will try to organize them in a useful way. Why Functional Programming (FP)? Why Scala? I enjoyed the talk given by Martin Odersky, which answer the two key questions with very simple code examples.

item.title: R for Data Science: Get ALL the Exercises Done!
item.description: 1. Data Visulization with ggplot2 The mpg dataset examples The diamonds dataset examples Position Adjustment and Coordinate Systems 2. Workflow:Basics & Shortcuts (print,<-,Alt+Shift+K,tab) 3. Data Transformation with dplyr Workflow scripts and Exploratory Data Analysis Reference: R for Data Science: Import, Tidy, Transform, Visualize, and Model Data Using R Markdown together with exercises in each chapter of this book, I am trying to document my learning path on R.

item.title: Another Note on A blogdown Tutorial
item.description: I just discovered an awesome tutorial on blogdown written by Alison. I have to admit this is the best blogdown tutorial I have seen so far.

item.title: A Quick Note on Two Beautiful Websites
item.description: To me, the two most impressive websites based on blogdown are: Rob J Hyndman‘s personal website. Live Free or Dichotomize by Lucy and Nick et al. I'm sure there will be more.
